title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

General Considerations

The response must correctly articulate a defensible claim/thesis that responds to the prompt and establishes a line of reasoning.

For Task A, the response must articulate a defensible claim/thesis that responds to the question and establishes a line of reasoning as to which of the three models of representative democracy—participatory, pluralist, or elite—best achieves the founders’ intent for American democracy in terms of ensuring a stable government run by the people.

For Task B1, the response provides one piece of evidence that is accurately linked to the topic of the question.

For Task B2, the response provides one piece of specific and relevant evidence to support the argument.

For Task B3, the response provides two pieces of specific and relevant evidence to support the argument.

For Task C, the response correctly explains why the evidence supports the claim or thesis.

For Task D, the response responds to an opposing or alternate perspective using rebuttal or refutation.

To earn points for Tasks B2, B3, C, and D, the response must first earn a point for Task A articulating a defensible claim/thesis.
descriptions: The response accomplishes none of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes one of the tasks set by the question.
The response accomplishes two of the tasks set by the question. For a student to earn a point for B2, B3, C, or D, they must first earn the A point.
The response accomplishes three of the tasks set by the question. For a student to earn a point for B2, B3, C, or D, they must first earn the A point.
The response accomplishes four of the tasks set by the question. For a student to earn a point for D, they must first earn the A point.
The response accomplishes five of the tasks set by the question. For a student to earn a point for B2, B3, C, or D they must first earn the A point.
The response accomplishes six of the tasks set by the question. For a student to earn a point for B2, B3, C, or D, they must first earn the A point.
